Binary Security Quality.description: A measure of how secure a binary is relevant to benchmarked binaries from stakeholder perspective.

Confidentiality.description: Information is not made available or disclosed to unauthorized individuals, entities, or processes.

Integrity.description: Data or processes cannot be modified in an unauthorized way.

Availability.description: Data and processes should be available at all times when deemed necessary.

Authenticity.description: Identity of individuals, entities, or processes is verified correctly.

Authorization.description: individuals, entities, or processes only have access to data and processes they should.

Non-repudiation.description: Individuals, entities, or processes may not deny any actions they performed.

CWE-22.description: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

CWE-59.description: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')

CWE-94.description: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')

CWE-119.description: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

CWE-120.description: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

CWE-200.description: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

CWE-362.description: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')

CWE-770.description: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

CWE-772.description: Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime

CWE-835.description: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

CWE-22 instance.description: This measure represents instances of a CWE, either CVE instances or non-CVE CWE instances.
